questions.title: Hello World
questions.description: Print the text `Hello, World!` to the console.
questions.starter_code_prompt: Generate starter code in {language} for a question titled 'Hello World'. Include a main function and a comment '// print Hello, World! here'. Return only the code.

questions.title: Variable Types
questions.description: Declare one variable of each type: an integer (42), a float (3.14), a string ('Alice'), and a boolean (true). Print each on a separate line.
questions.starter_code_prompt: Generate starter code in {language} for a question titled 'Variable Types'. Include a main function and a comment '// declare and print integer, float, string, and boolean variables here'. Do not pre-declare any variables. Return only the code.

questions.title: Arithmetic Operations
questions.description: Given a = 10 and b = 3, print the result of addition, subtraction, multiplication, integer division, and modulo each on its own line.
constraints: Use integer division, not float division
questions.starter_code_prompt: Generate starter code in {language} for a question titled 'Arithmetic Operations'. Include a main function and a comment '// declare a=10, b=3, and print arithmetic results here'. Do not pre-declare variables. Return only the code.

questions.title: String Concatenation
questions.description: Given s1 = 'Hello' and s2 = 'World', print them joined with a space, then print the length of the resulting string.
questions.starter_code_prompt: Generate starter code in {language} for a question titled 'String Concatenation'. Include a main function and a comment '// declare s1, s2, concatenate with a space, and print result and length here'. Do not pre-declare variables. Return only the code.

questions.title: Constants
questions.description: Declare a constant PI with value 3.14159 and a constant MAX with value 100. Print both on separate lines.
questions.starter_code_prompt: Generate starter code in {language} for a question titled 'Constants'. Include a main function and a comment '// declare constants PI and MAX and print them here'. Do not pre-declare constants. Return only the code.

questions.title: If / Else
questions.description: Given x = 15, print 'positive' if x is greater than 0, 'negative' if less than 0, or 'zero' if equal to 0.
questions.starter_code_prompt: Generate starter code in {language} for a question titled 'If / Else'. Include a main function and a comment '// declare x=15 and implement if/else logic here'. Do not pre-declare the variable or structure. Return only the code.

questions.title: FizzBuzz
questions.description: Loop through numbers 1 to 20. Print 'FizzBuzz' if divisible by both 3 and 5, 'Fizz' if divisible by 3, 'Buzz' if divisible by 5, or the number.
questions.starter_code_prompt: Generate starter code in {language} for a question titled 'FizzBuzz'. Include a main function and a comment '// implement FizzBuzz loop from 1 to 20 here'. Do not pre-declare the loop. Return only the code.

questions.title: While Loop
questions.description: Use a while loop to print the powers of 2 from 2^0 to 2^9, one per line.
questions.starter_code_prompt: Generate starter code in {language} for a question titled 'While Loop'. Include a main function and a comment '// implement while loop to print powers of 2 here'. Do not pre-declare counters or loop structures. Return only the code.

questions.title: Switch / Match Statement
questions.description: Given day = 'Wednesday', use a switch or match statement to print 'Weekday', 'Weekend', or 'Unknown'.
questions.starter_code_prompt: Generate starter code in {language} for a question titled 'Switch/Match'. Include a main function and a comment '// declare day and implement switch/match logic here'. Do not pre-declare variables. Return only the code.

questions.title: Break and Continue
questions.description: Loop 1 to 10. Skip 5, break at 8. Print each processed number.
questions.starter_code_prompt: Generate starter code in {language} for a question titled 'Break and Continue'. Include a main function and a comment '// implement loop with break and continue logic here'. Do not pre-declare the loop. Return only the code.

questions.title: Basic Function
questions.description: Write a function add(a, b) and call it with (7, 5) and (-3, 3).
questions.starter_code_prompt: Generate starter code in {language} for a question titled 'Basic Function'. Include a main function and a comment '// define add function and call it with sample values here'. Return only the code.

questions.title: Default Parameters
questions.description: Write a function power(base, exponent=2). Call as power(3) and power(2, 8).
questions.starter_code_prompt: Generate starter code in {language} for a question titled 'Default Parameters'. Include a main function and a comment '// define function with default parameter and call it here'. Return only the code.

questions.title: Recursive Factorial
questions.description: Write a recursive function factorial(n). Call with 5.
questions.starter_code_prompt: Generate starter code in {language} for a question titled 'Recursive Factorial'. Include a main function and a comment '// define recursive factorial function and call it here'. Return only the code.

questions.title: Multiple Return Values
questions.description: Write a function min_max(numbers) that returns both the min and max of a list.
questions.starter_code_prompt: Generate starter code in {language} for a question titled 'Multiple Return Values'. Include a main function and a comment '// define min_max function and call it with [4, 1, 9, 3, 7] here'. Return only the code.

questions.title: Higher-Order Functions
questions.description: Write a function apply(func, value). Define double(x). Call apply(double, 5).
questions.starter_code_prompt: Generate starter code in {language} for a question titled 'Higher-Order Functions'. Include a main function and a comment '// define double and apply functions and call them here'. Return only the code.

questions.title: Array / List Basics
questions.description: Create a list [10, 20, 30, 40, 50]. Print first, last, and iterate to print all.
questions.starter_code_prompt: Generate starter code in {language} for a question titled 'List Basics'. Include a main function and a comment '// create list, print first/last, and iterate here'. Do not pre-declare the list. Return only the code.

questions.title: List Mutation

questions.starter_code_prompt: Generate starter code in {language} for a question titled 'List Mutation'. Include a main function and a comment '// declare mutable list, append 9, remove 1, and print results here'. Do not pre-declare the list. Return only the code.

questions.starter_code_prompt: Generate starter code in {language} for a question titled 'Filter and Map'. Include a main function and a comment '// declare list and implement filter/map logic here'. Do not pre-declare variables. Return only the code.

questions.starter_code_prompt: Generate starter code in {language} for a question titled 'Custom Sorting'. Include a main function and a comment '// declare list and implement two sorting logics here'. Do not pre-declare the list. Return only the code.
